_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Farm Product Raw Material Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Farmward Cooperative

320 West 1st St.

Morton Mn, 56270

(507)697-6113



For further information contact Aaron Guggisberg, Safety Director

Risk Management- Executive summary



1. The Facility Policy



The ownwers,management and employees of Farmward cooperative are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of Anhydrous Ammonia and Propane if an accidental release should occur. The facility is prepared to work with local fire department and other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2. Farmward Cooperative Information



 The primary activity at the facility is the storage and handling of Anhydrous ammonia and Propane sold to Farmward Customers.



 Anhydrous Ammonia is received, stored and distributed for the direct application for crop production in the area.



 Propane is stored and distributed to the customers of Farmward Cooperative for Home heating, Livestock heating and corn Drying in the area



The maximum quanity of anhydrous ammonia stored at this facility is 228,000 pounds in supply tanks and running stock. The maximum quanity of propane stored at this facility is 120,000 pounds in storage tanks.



 The Five year accident history for Farmward Coop at this location 

 a. There has been no accidental release of anhydrous ammonia or propane in the past five years



 b. None have caused any deaths,injuries, or significant property damage at Harvestland Cooperative.



 C. To the best of Farmward Coop's employee's knowledge none have resulted in offsite deaths,injuries evacuations,sheltering in place property damage, or enviromental damage.



 6. Farmward Cooperative Emergency response program.



     Farmward Cooperative

 a. A written emergency action plan in accordance with OSHA standard. 29 CFR 1910.38



 b. Farmward has provided state and local authorities the emergency planning and community Right to Know information as required under SARA title III (EPCRA)

c. Coordinated with emergency responders.



7. Farmward Cooperative plans to change as needed to improve safety.



 Safety improvements are an on going process at this facility. Periodic evaluations and inspections are preformed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions. There are no additional specific Anhydrous Ammonia or Propane safety Recommendations for implentation at this time. 





                                                                                                    Aaron Guggisberg

                                                                                                    Farmward Cooperative

                                                                                                    Safety Director
